text: The Martin Luther University of Halle-Wittenberg (German: Martin-Luther- Universität Halle-Wittenberg, shortened MLU) is a German public university in Halle and Wittenberg, in the state of Saxony-Anhalt. It was established by a merger in 1817 and is named after Martin Luther. President is Udo Sträter. It had nearly 20,000 students in 2015. Its focus is on all sorts of sciences. == Other websites == * Category:1817 establishments in Europe Category:1810s establishments in Germany Category:Colleges and universities in Germany Category:Halle, Saxony-Anhalt Category:Martin Luther Category:Saxony-Anhalt
title: Martin Luther University of Halle-Wittenberg
